intro: Ipomoea volcanensis, commonly known as the volcanic morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant is typically found growing in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Ipomoea volcanensis is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in nutrient-rich soils.
